title: Outstanding service
text: Fantastic wedding reception for our daughter at this amazing hotel. The staff were so friendly and attentive - we had a truly wonderful and special weekend. This boutique style hotel is very unique and we look forward to returning soon. Thank you everyone!

title: Memorable memorial
text: A haunting site - visit with a tour guide to fully understand and respect this important Berlin memorial.
place: The Holocaust Memorial - Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe

title: A historic site
text: Definitely worth visiting day or night - take the walking tour to get the most out of your trip and understand the history of Berlin.

title: Fantastic walking tour experience
text: A most amazing historic experience through the eyes and words of Canadian Chris - his knowledge and thoughtful views, anecdotes and interpretations made this a truly memorable tour.

title: Fabulous overnight stay
text: What a wonderful hotel. I was fortunate enough to be upgraded to a suite and it was a fabulous overnight stay. The room was perfect and even had a kitchen. The bath was deep and luxurious and everything was spotlessly clean. The bed was so comfortable and I could have stayed for so much longer!

title: What a view!
text: Worth the climb up to the top of the fort for the spectacular views out to sea and of the old town - stop at the harbour below for drinks and people watching - particularly the Game of Throne tours!

title: Paradise
text: Go early - first boat out is at 9am. I spent 4 hours exploring and enjoying swimming in the Dead Sea lake and the sea. If you have time, go for the whole day.

title: Fabulous views
text: Worth the trip for the spectacular views - stop for refreshments and further enjoyment of Dubrovnik and the surrounding area.

title: Stunning
text: Spectacular 360 degrees panoramic views of this wonderful UNESCO site - what a privilege to be able to walk the walls and see so much of this beautiful old town from different angles - start at a non-busier point near the harbour and stop for refreshments to enjoy the view of Lokrum Island and beyond.

title: Small but perfectly formed
text: She is petite but definitely worth a visit. Following a lovely walk with lots to see, she is great to see from the front. I also saw her from the back (with lots of tourists) on the boat trip (another must!). Even though it's busy everyone was courteous and allowed space for others to take photos.

title: Traditional fare in fun surroundings
text: I enjoyed a traditional open shrimp sandwich at this popular restaurant. It was busy but the staff were attentive.

title: Wonderful history walking tour
text: A fantastic walking tour filled with charm and history, delivered by the wonderful pocket rocket that is Bodil. She was totally fabulous and captured the beauty of Copenhagen through a charming stories and anecdotes.
place: Red Badge Guides - Private and Public Guided Tours

title: Beautiful walk with lovely vistas
text: Worth a walk through the area from or to viewing The Little Mermaid - it was a beautiful sunny day and the setting was picture perfect.

title: Impressive inside and out
text: Lots to take in and see but it is very dark inside so maybe worth bringing a torch! It wasn't busy when I visited so not sure how crowded it might get, particularly on the stairways.

title: Fabulous views of the city
text: Prepare yourself for a steep climb inside and outside! On reaching what I thought was the top of the spire - you then venture outside to climb more steps, in a helter skelter form, on the outside of the building! Great views of the city but a scary climb up and descent down!

title: Great experience
text: Lots to do - I arrived early evening and spent several hours here and had dinner. Mini version of Toytown and Disneyland Paris mesh!

title: Buzzy part of town
text: Worth a stop - find out the history - lots of information on a walking tour. I went on a boat tour from here and it was a great experience (smaller boat - later in the day - and less busy).

title: Charming hotel in great location
text: Fab location close to central station and within easy distance of sites and attractions, particularly Tivoli Gardens. Mini heatwave when I visited but the fan in the room was good and useful as no a/c. Spotlessly clean with a bath. Each room has been individually decorated and dedicated to an architect - I was in a 50s room. Reception staff polite and helpful, particularly April. Great stay - just note that Copenhagen is expensive! A Copenhagen card is a must - from an information centre - gets you free access to most places plus free travel on metro and buses - it was invaluable!

title: Fabulous views of a stunning city
text: An anniversary gift to The Shard presented us with amazing views of beautiful London town. It was more than we expected with not many other visitors. A glass of champagne and some commemorative photographs topped off a lovely evening.

title: Fine dining in beautiful surrounds
text: It was our anniversary dinner following a trip to the Shard. What a fabulous restaurant in a stunning building. The food and wine were delicious accompanied by attentive, great service. It was a total delight and the anniversary chocolates at the end of our meal were a lovely touch. Thank you Galvin La Chapelle!

title: Thought provoking and beautiful
text: This is a must visit - our tour guide was excellent and brought the whole experience to life. It is a beautiful synagogue with an emotional and historical past - stop by the museum too.

title: Fabulous boutique style hotel in a central location
text: This is a gorgeous hotel in an amazing building. The boutique style hotel is situated on the third and fourth floors of a historic building that also housed the Ecuadorian Embassy. The room was gorgeous with a huge comfortable bed and lots of nice touches to make your stay as fabulous as possible. The staff were fantastic and so hopeful, particularly Marcel who helped guide me through the must see parts of the city with some great recommendations. Breakfast was fab too in their own restaurant on the ground floor.

title: Impressive
text: Enjoy a stop at Heroes' Square and the museums that sit either side of the square. The statues and monuments are monumental.

title: Impressive basilica
text: Worth a visit on your trip - it is as splendid inside as outside - take time to look round and enjoy this beautiful basilica.

title: Take a night cruise
text: In my opinion, Budapest is best seen at night from the River Danube. The cruise was great fun with lots of sights to take in - all topped off with a glass of bubbly!

title: Decadent and glorious
text: An amazing building to visit - I recommend you book a tour and get there in time to ensure you get your slot as sometimes the next one may be in a different language. The tour guide Levi was excellent!

title: Food - ok / Hungarian wine - delicious
text: This is a busy restaurant - it was lively and busy even at 6.30pm so if you want to visit I recommend you book. I had Hungarian stew which was ok and the Turo gombic dessert which was interesting - the best part of the meal was the wine - Hungarian wine is tasty!

title: Fun but congested roads
text: Budapest is a busy city with a huge amount of traffic. The combined ticket of bus and boat is the best way to see the city - especially the night cruise. You can spend a lot of time sitting in traffic so plan your route wisely!
place: City Sightseeing Budapest Hop-On Hop-Off Tours

title: Vibrant & energetic
text: We were told that the tip is to bag a table and then send various members of your group out to different food/drink outlets to bring back for you all to enjoy. The choice is insane and you could probably spend a week there trying out all the delicious delicacies and drinks and still not have tried everything. Loved the buzzy feel of this wonderful indoor market. It is very busy!

title: Fantastico
text: What a beautiful palace - impressive both inside and out! We visited on a Monday in April and it was very busy - we brought tickets in advance but still queued for half an hour and another 20minutes to get our audio guide. It was well worth the wait - thoroughly impressive and enjoyable. They are very strict on taking photos in certain parts of the palace - and that made for great comedy as people were being literally evicted from certain rooms! I recommend checking the audio guide works before setting off, particularly the sound.

title: Fabulous Airbnb walking tour with Leila
text: Absolutely fantastic morning walking tour with Leila who was brilliant. She took us to places that we would never have found and was so knowledgeable, interesting and upbeat. We took in a number of historical quarters, ancient walls - some hidden (Muslim and Christian), amazing food markets and we even visited an ancient church where the nuns still bake biscuits... and bought a box! We were so lucky because it was the day of the Madrid Marathon and the roads were carless and there was a great atmosphere. Leila also followed up the experience with a summary of our itinerary and lots of additional recommendations for food and drink. Fantastic Leila - thank you!

title: Big but not beautiful
text: I had a good night's sleep - the bed was very comfortable. However, I felt the whole experience impersonal - even though staff were relatively friendly and helpful I never got the feeling that I was particularly welcomed and this is something that can easily be remedied. I mentioned, on leaving, that the breakfast could be improved. There were not a lot of guests staying and the food had been sitting on the heated trays for a while so everything was warm but tasteless. The signage outside and inside the hotel could also be improved - I had trouble finding my way from the car park to Reception and other guests mentioned that finding their way to their rooms from the lifts was challenging!

title: Grounds not castle
text: Ensure you know that you are visiting the grounds rather than the castle itself - you get to see one room. It's worth the trip - the scenery along route plus the castle setting is gorgeous. I spent over an hour walking around the gardens and grounds.

title: Fabulous tour
text: I enjoyed a wonderful one hour (plus) guided tour with a very knowledgeable guide and also a visit to the walled gardens.

title: Bracing walk
text: A beautiful (unusual) sunny day and walk to Footdee, walking through the fishermen's homes to the sea front and crashing waves of the North Sea.

title: Excellent and informative
text: A well designed and thought provoking insight into life in the North Sea. A shout out to the really helpful staff - Susy and Sara.

title: Excellent fresh fish
text: The food was exceptional - I had mussels to start and the catch of the day all washed down by a chilled glass of pinot grigio.

title: A pot of gold at the end of a rainbow
text: A mind-blowing, living museum in a beautiful setting. The treasures, paintings and attention to detail in every space are outstanding. The dining room, lobby, library and other common areas are steeped in history. This is a true jewel - I can't wait to return for a longer visit.

title: A fabulous experience
text: This amazing fortress is steeped in history and the views are spectacular. I spent hours enjoying the views and experience both at the castle and surrounding area, including the mini Greek temple on the neighbouring headland.

title: Good local in Plaka
text: Good local food and very reasonably priced. I ate in the evening and had the most fantastic views of the Acropolis and Ancient Agora. They also have their own musicians - excellent!

title: Quirky cafe bistrot
text: A treasure trove of quirkiness - if you can find it! A pretty young crowd but everyone was super friendly and it was a great fun place for either lunch or dinner, or anything in between.

title: Amazing ruin and museum
text: This is in Plaka and one of my favourite places in Athens - the grounds, museum and temple are fantastic - worth a visit for an hour or two and then a stop at a local restaurant.

title: Massive fleamarket
text: Fantastic atmosphere - day and night - with bustling shops, restaurants and market stalls. There are also some great sights to see.

title: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
text: This is a jaw dropping amazing destination that you must visit once in your lifetime. Go early to beat the coach visitors.

title: Awe inspiring
text: Well worth the climb to the top - fantastic, historical relic that will leave you breathless - it's a steep climb so wear trainers!

title: An absolute must
text: Beautiful museum which is an absolute must when you visit the Acropolis. The book shop is excellent - and so many books in so many different languages.

title: Amazing views
text: A good quality, slightly old fashioned hotel. The rooftop restaurant/bar/terrace is amazing with spectacular views of the Acropolis and surrounding sights. The bedroom was large and clean and well equipped. The location of this hotel is the main selling point - everything was close by and the reception staff were extremely helpful when I asked for advice.

title: A ghost town
text: Well worth a visit to this crumbling town that has been deserted for over 100 years. The drive to the town is pretty hair raising with an un-tarmacked road and steep inclines and bends. The views are spectacular but keep your eyes on the road! It is a pretty scary sight and we had been told tales of ghosts!

title: Blink and you'll miss it
text: Make sure you stop and visit this wonderful gem of a lake and hermitage. You can access the hermitage by steps at the back of the altar in the church.

title: A hidden gem
text: Stop here for a wonderful view of the lake. We went out of season and it was a lovely sunny day - on a warm day it's worth stopping here with a picnic. The lake is a wonderful colour - go into the church (second on your left) - it looks closed but unlock it from the outside and walk past the altar - climb some steps and you will find the hidden sanctuary of San Domenico.

title: Good home cooking
text: We had a delicious 3 course lunch. The food is made fresh on the premises in this family run business - we had a delicious pasta dish, followed by lamb and vegetables plus a delicious panna cotta! It was out of season and we were the only family in the restaurant but it was a lovely meal.

title: A bijou jewel
text: What a jewel of a boutique hotel - small but perfectly formed and built into the rock face of this beautiful and historical city. Francoise (the wonderful hostess) and Nougat (her beautiful jack russell assistant) made the trip extra special. There are only four rooms and I was in the attic - it was a steep climb, up two spiral staircases, but beautifully appointed with a huge bath. Breakfast was delicious and I wanted to stay longer. It's a very special place - make sure you stop by!

title: Impressive historic landmark
text: A museum full of historical artefacts mainly military. There is also a network of underground tunnels. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Unbelievable inside and out
text: This museum is partly built into the rock of the oldest part of the city. A must visit - with lots of important artefacts of importance to the city plus an amazing lift.

title: Toy town in grand scale
text: I only saw this from the outside but most impressive - you can book a tour to visit inside when the Grand Duke isn't around. I enjoyed a hot chocolate opposite whilst watching the soldiers marching up and down.
place: Palace of the Grand Dukes (Palais Grand-Ducal)

title: Sensational museum
text: Fantastic building and wonderful galleries and exhibits - visit, you won't be disappointed and also go next door to the polar opposite in terms of history to Musee Drai Eechelen

title: Fascinating museum
text: Give yourself enough time to visit - there are a huge number of exhibits across 9 floors with some underground. A must place to visit.
place: National Museum of Art and History (Musee National d'Histoire et d'Art)

title: Wonderful restaurant with lots of hidden gems
text: Great Italian restaurant with an excellent menu. The owner, Alain, is charming and the restaurant also has its own wine cellar and a disco that is opened on Fridays and Saturdays (until 6am).

title: Attentive staff and good food
text: I was the first to arrive at this restaurant during my one night stay in Lisbon and the staff were attentive and provided lots of good advice for local food and wine. I enjoyed the cod balls and the pork shank polished off with a delicious glass of Portugese red. it's a cosy restaurant with staff that went out of their way to make me feel at home in Lisbon.
